trans-unit.source: Provides methods for encoding and decoding URLs when processing Web requests.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpUtility> class contains encoding and decoding utility methods for use with HTML-encode strings.
The <xref:System.Uri?displayProperty=fullName> class also contains methods and properties that can be used for similar purposes.
Converts a string that has been HTML-encoded for HTTP transmission into a decoded string.
If characters such as blanks and punctuation are passed in an HTTP stream, they might be misinterpreted at the receiving end.
HTML encoding converts characters that are not allowed in HTML into character-entity equivalents; HTML decoding reverses the encoding.
For example, when embedded in a block of text, the characters \< and > are encoded as < and > for HTTP transmission.
If the `value` parameter is `null`, then the returned decoded string is `null`.
If the `value` parameter is an empty string, then the returned decoded string is an empty string.
The string to decode.
A decoded string.
Converts a string that has been HTML-encoded into a decoded string, and sends the decoded string to a <xref href="System.IO.TextWriter"></xref> output stream.
If characters such as blanks and punctuation are passed in an HTTP stream, they might be misinterpreted at the receiving end.
HTML encoding converts characters that are not allowed in HTML into character-entity equivalents; HTML decoding reverses the encoding.
For example, when embedded in a block of text, the characters \< and > are encoded as < and > for HTTP transmission.
The string to decode.
A <xref href="System.IO.TextWriter"></xref> stream of output.
The output parameter cannot be `null` if the value parameter is not `null`.
Converts a string to an HTML-encoded string.
If characters such as blanks and punctuation are passed in an HTTP stream, they might be misinterpreted at the receiving end.
HTML encoding converts characters that are not allowed in HTML into character-entity equivalents; HTML decoding reverses the encoding.
For example, when embedded in a block of text, the characters \< and > are encoded as < and > for HTTP transmission.
If the `value` parameter is `null`, then the returned encoded string is `null`.
If the `value` parameter is an empty string, then the returned encoded string is an empty string.
The string to encode.
An encoded string.
Converts a string into an HTML-encoded string, and returns the output as a <xref href="System.IO.TextWriter"></xref> stream of output.
If characters such as blanks and punctuation are passed in an HTTP stream, they might be misinterpreted at the receiving end.
HTML encoding converts characters that are not allowed in HTML into character-entity equivalents; HTML decoding reverses the encoding.
For example, when embedded in a block of text, the characters \< and >, are encoded as < and > for HTTP transmission.
The string to encode.
A <xref href="System.IO.TextWriter"></xref> output stream.
The output parameter cannot be `null` if the value parameter is not `null`.
Converts a string that has been encoded for transmission in a URL into a decoded string.
If characters such as blanks and punctuation are passed in an HTTP stream, they might be misinterpreted at the receiving end.
URL encoding converts characters that are not allowed in a URL into equivalent hexadecimal escape sequences.
The <xref:System.Net.WebUtility.UrlEncode%2A> method creates a URL-encoded string.
URL decoding replaces hexadecimal escape sequences with corresponding ASCII character equivalents.
For example, when embedded in a block of URL-encoded text, the escape sequences `%3c` and `%3e` are decoded into the characters `<` and `>`.
A URL-encoded string to decode.
Returns <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
A decoded string.
Converts an encoded byte array that has been encoded for transmission in a URL into a decoded byte array.
If characters such as blanks and punctuation are passed in an HTTP stream, they might be misinterpreted at the receiving end.
URL encoding converts characters that are not allowed in a URL into equivalent hexadecimal escape sequences.
The <xref:System.Net.WebUtility.UrlEncodeToBytes%2A> method creates a URL-encoded byte array.
URL decoding replaces hexadecimal escape sequences with corresponding ASCII character equivalents.
For example, when embedded in a block of URL-encoded text, the escape sequences `%3c` and `%3e` are decoded into the characters `<` and `>`.
A URL-encoded <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> array to decode.
The offset, in bytes, from the start of the <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> array to decode.
The count, in bytes, to decode from the <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> array.
Returns <xref href="System.Byte"></xref>.
A decoded <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> array.
Converts a text string into a URL-encoded string.
If characters such as blanks and punctuation are passed in an HTTP stream, they might be misinterpreted at the receiving end.
URL encoding replaces characters that are not allowed in a URL with character-entity equivalents consisting of hexadecimal escape sequences.
The converted string is expected to conform to the UTF-8 format.
URL encoding replaces all character codes except for letters, numbers, and the following punctuation characters:
`-` (minus sign`)`
`_` (underscore`)`
`.` (period`)`
`!` (exclamation point`)`
\* (asterisk)
`(` and `)` (opening and closing parentheses)
For example, when embedded in a block of text to be transmitted in a URL, the characters `<` and `>` are encoded as `%3c` and `%3e`.
The <xref:System.Net.WebUtility.UrlDecode%2A> method reverses the encoding.
The text to URL-encode.
Returns <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
A URL-encoded string.
Converts a byte array into a URL-encoded byte array.
If characters such as blanks and punctuation are passed in an HTTP stream, they might be misinterpreted at the receiving end.
URL encoding replaces characters that are not allowed in a URL with character-entity equivalents consisting of hexadecimal escape sequences.
The converted string is expected to conform to the UTF-8 format.
URL encoding replaces all character codes except for letters, numbers, and the following punctuation characters:
`-` (minus sign)
`_` (underscore)
`.` (period)
`!` (exclamation point)
'*' (asterisk)
`'` (single quotation mark)
`(` and `)` (opening and closing parentheses)
For example, when embedded in a block of text to be transmitted in a URL, the characters `<` and `>` are encoded as `%3c` and `%3e`.
The <xref:System.Net.WebUtility.UrlDecodeToBytes%2A> method reverses the encoding.
The <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> array to URL-encode.
The offset, in bytes, from the start of the <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> array to encode.
The count, in bytes, to encode from the <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> array.
Returns <xref href="System.Byte"></xref>.
An encoded <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> array.
